shortDescription: Email Links Now Open Gmail Directly (Desktop Compatibility)
problem: Email links using mailto: protocol were not working on desktop computers - clicking them did nothing because Chrome had no configured default email client
cause: Desktop browsers require a configured email client for mailto: links to work, while mobile devices handle this automatically through their built-in mail apps

solution.phase1: Identified that ContactInfo.tsx was not the actual component being used in the contact details view
solution.phase2: Found that IndividualFormRenderer.tsx was the main component rendering contact fields in disabled mode
solution.phase3: Created clickable links that display instead of disabled input fields when in read-only mode
solution.phase4: Replaced all mailto: links with direct Gmail web interface URLs (https://mail.google.com/mail/?view=cm&to=email)
solution.phase5: Updated all contact-related components to use the new Gmail direct links

testing: User confirmed that email links now work on desktop - clicking them opens Gmail in a new tab
notes: Phone links (tel:) were already working on desktop and remain unchanged
Email links now work universally without requiring browser email client configuration
Added target='_blank' and rel='noopener noreferrer' for security and UX
All email links now open Gmail compose window with pre-filled recipient
relatedBackups: Previous work on clickable email/phone links in contact components
